definition: to scale (a height)/to ascend/to mount/to publish or record/to enter (e.g. in a register)/to press down with the foot/to step or tread on/to put on (shoes or trousers) (dialect)/to be gathered and taken to the threshing ground (old)
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: Professor Lu Yang stood on the plane's entrance and waved good-bye to us.
sentences.chinese: 陸楊教授站在飛機的登機口前向我們揮手告別。

sentences.english: Your stroller (pram) has been put at the boarding gate.
sentences.chinese: 您的嬰兒車已經放在登機口了。

sentences.english: Boarding at gate 3 in about half an hour.
sentences.chinese: 請在半小時後在3號登機口登機。

sentences.english: Parents used to take children out to departure gates to watch planes land and take off.
sentences.chinese: 過去家長常常帶孩子去登機口看飛機起飛降落。

sentences.english: Which is the gate for connecting flight 707 to San Francisco?
sentences.chinese: 我應該在哪個登機口轉乘707航班到舊金山？

definition: luggage that has been checked in (on flight)
domestic flight/internal line (air, train, ferry etc)
number plate/car license plate/CL:條|条[tiao2],塊|块[kuai4],片[pian4]
to buy or upgrade a ticket after boarding a train, boat etc/to buy a ticket for a show after having sat down in the theater
